block.p: Melike Suna Oncu, the daughter of Tuba and Irfan Oncu of Gulph Mills, Pa., was married last evening to Ross Emanuel Wiener, a son of Louise Weingarten Wiener and Dr. Jerry M. Wiener of Chevy Chase, Md. Judge Kermit V. Lipez of the United States Court of Appeals for the First Circuit, for whom the bridegroom was a law clerk, officiated at the Migis Lodge on Sebago Lake in South Casco, Me.
The bride, a graduate of Lafayette College, and the bridegroom, who graduated from the University of Wisconsin at Madison, received law degrees from George Washington University, where they met.

Melike Suna Oncu, the daughter of Tuba and Irfan Oncu of Gulph Mills, Pa., was married last evening to Ross Emanuel Wiener, a son of Louise Weingarten Wiener and Dr. Jerry M. Wiener of Chevy Chase, Md. Judge Kermit V. Lipez of the United States Court of Appeals for the First Circuit, for whom the bridegroom was a law clerk, officiated at the Migis Lodge on Sebago Lake in South Casco, Me.
The bride, a graduate of Lafayette College, and the bridegroom, who graduated from the University of Wisconsin at Madison, received law degrees from George Washington University, where they met.

Both now work in Washington, where the bride, 29, is a corporate law associate at Swidler Berlin Shereff Friedman, a law firm, and the bridegroom, 30, is a trial attorney in the civil rights division of the Justice Department.

The bride's father is an assistant vice president for engineering with Amtrak in Philadelphia, where her mother, now retired, was an office manager at the Alternative Medicine Network, a former holistic health center.

The bridegroom's mother is the founder and president of Learning and Leadership in Families, a nonprofit organization for museum and early childhood education. His father is an emeritus professor in residence of psychiatry and of pediatrics at the George Washington University Medical Center and the chairman of the American Psychiatric Press. Dr. Wiener is also a former president of the American Psychiatric Association and the American Academy of Child and Adolescent Psychiatry.
